paper: Benchmarking Stochastic Approximation Algorithms for Fairness-Constrained Training of Deep Neural Networks

differences.summary: SSL-ALM inequality handling ambiguity (slack variables, multipliers/projection)
differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines method soundness and comparability; harms reproducibility

evidence.baseline_quote: SSL-ALM is adapted to inequality constraints via slack variables and smoothing (Section 3.3).
evidence.final_quote: Slack variables are mentioned but absent from equations; multiplier/projection handling are unclear (Section 3.3).

differences.summary: StGh undefined parameter and inconsistent mini-batch notation
differences.why_impacts_score: Signals implementation/notation errors, weakening interpretability and trust

evidence.baseline_quote: Unbiased direction estimation via multilevel sampling (Eq. (8)–(9); Algorithm 1).
evidence.final_quote: λ = 0.5 is listed but undefined; Eq. (9) uses 2N+1 vs 2^{N+1}.

differences.summary: Stronger critique of constraint–metric misalignment and conflicting sufficiency narrative
differences.why_impacts_score: Conflicting claims vs. results reduce validity of conclusions

evidence.baseline_quote: Constraint is loss-difference; reported metrics Ind/Sp/Sf not optimized by constraint; sufficiency degradation not analyzed.
evidence.final_quote: Narrative conflicts with Table 3: test Sf for SGD-Fairret is higher than for SGD, creating confusion.

differences.summary: Technical Quality lowered due to added gaps/inconsistencies
differences.why_impacts_score: Explicit rationale ties additional issues to lower technical score

evidence.baseline_quote: Technical Quality (10): 5 — Algorithms accurately described but reporting lacks key details; alignment could be improved.
evidence.final_quote: Technical Quality (10): 4 — Reporting contains notable gaps and inconsistencies, hindering reproducibility and interpretation.
